item.title: My new site design
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:15, topic:123695”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=173496.msg1606631#msg1606631 date=1184735738]
i know, but my web hoster wont email me back
[/quote]

It has nothing to do with your webhoster. Your CSS is at fault, not your webhoster. I see numerous references to classes that weren’t called upon.[/quote]
wrong*
when i use a batch file for my own webserver, it works fine

item.title: My new site design
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:10, topic:123695”][quote author=fellixombc link=topic=173496.msg1603302#msg1603302 date=1184653382]

[/quote]

That’s not the problem. The problem is that you didn’t code to standards, therefore triggering quirks mode and screwing up your site.[/quote]

yeah, i dont know why but my site sucks since it cant show css for firefox users

That’s not the problem. The problem is that you didn’t code to standards, therefore triggering quirks mode and screwing up your site.

item.title: My new site design
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

welshy:

dude atleast he trys, you think your all f-ing good sohwing him a ‘real’ site which i bet will suck. Honestly even if it isnt the best i bet your not f-ing good either. i cant wait to see your shitty little site! dont even post back cos i wont respond

I wasn’t shooting him down. I was giving a rather objective view on how to fix up his site. And no, I’m not good at all, you’re right. I can’t design websites. I can’t believe my life has all been a lie. If it weren’t for you, I would have continued my days as a sham. Oh wait. I don’t suck.

And believe me, I’ll show you my ‘shitty little site.’ Stay on MITB, k? I’ll show it to you when I’m done.

Read full topic

item.title: My new site design
item.dc:creator: @welshy welshy
item.description:
@welshy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:2, topic:123695”]I can’t say it looks good. The default font (looks like Times) should be swapped for a more web-friendly font such as Verdana, then sized to 10px. You should fix it up to XHTML 1.0 standards if you choose to take it that far. The mouse-overs are temperamental (go with CSS, not JS) on the buttons, and the font is over-used and out of context. The banner is meh, I’d either go with a text design or a better image (less grainy?).

I’d show you the site I’m working on, but I signed an NDA. I’ll show you in September what a real site looks like.[/quote] dude atleast he trys, you think your all f-ing good sohwing him a ‘real’ site which i bet will suck. Honestly even if it isnt the best i bet your not f-ing good either. i cant wait to see your shitty little site! dont even post back cos i wont respond

Read full topic

item.title: My new site design
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I can’t say it looks good. The default font (looks like Times) should be swapped for a more web-friendly font such as Verdana, then sized to 10px. You should fix it up to XHTML 1.0 standards if you choose to take it that far. The mouse-overs are temperamental (go with CSS, not JS) on the buttons, and the font is over-used and out of context. The banner is meh, I’d either go with a text design or a better image (less grainy?).

I’d show you the site I’m working on, but I signed an NDA. I’ll show you in September what a real site looks like.

Read full topic
